breed.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: if animals breed, they mate in order to have babies
breed.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Eagles breed during the cooler months of the year.
breed.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to keep animals or plants in order to produce babies or new plants, especially ones with particular qualities
breed.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: These dogs were originally bred in Scotland to round up sheep.
breed.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to cause a particular feeling or condition
breed.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Poor living conditions breed violence and despair.
breed.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: if a place, situation, or thing breeds a particular type of person, it produces that type
breed.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: Societyâ€™s obsession with sex has bred a generation of unhappy children.
breed.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a type of animal that is kept as a pet or on a farm
breed.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Spaniels are my favourite breed of dog.
breed.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: a particular kind of person or type of thing
breed.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: Real cowboys are a dying breed  (=not many exist anymore).
Dodd was one of that rare breed  (=there are not many of them) who could make the game of football look simple.
a new breed of international criminal
